privacy.dad_quote: Son, I've been reading the terms and conditions since 1987. Still on page 1.
privacy.summary_point_1: 100% free - No accounts, no payments, no personal information
privacy.summary_point_2: All data stored locally on your device (LocalStorage)
privacy.summary_point_3: Optional analytics that respect your privacy
privacy.summary_point_4: No data selling, sharing, or tracking across websites
privacy.overview_content: At DadDeckâ„¢, we take your privacy as seriously as a dad takes his lawn care routine. This privacy policy explains how we handle your data when you use our free trading card simulator. Spoiler alert: We don't collect much, and what we do collect stays on your device.
privacy.data_content: We believe in minimal data collection. Here's what we gather:
privacy.localstorage_content: We use your browser's LocalStorage to save your card collection, deck configurations, and game preferences. This data lives ONLY on your device - we never see it, touch it, or send it anywhere. It's like your dad's workshop: organized, private, and nobody else knows where anything is. Technical details: We store collection data (cards, packs opened, deck configurations) and user preferences (theme, language, audio settings) in LocalStorage with automatic quota management.
privacy.analytics_content: We use privacy-focused analytics to understand how people use DadDeckâ„¢. This helps us improve the game without compromising your privacy. We track: Page visits (anonymously), Feature usage (which features get used most), Performance metrics (load times, errors). We DO NOT track: Personal information, Individual user behavior across sessions, Your location or device fingerprint. You can opt-out of analytics anytime in your browser settings or by using privacy extensions.
privacy.browser_content: Like all websites, your browser automatically sends basic technical information: Browser type and version, Operating system, Screen resolution, Language preference. This is standard web functionality that helps us display the site correctly on your device. We don't store or analyze this data separately.
privacy.usage_content: We use your data for exactly three things: (1) Saving your game progress so you don't lose your collection when you close the browser. (2) Improving the game experience based on analytics. (3) Ensuring the site works correctly on your device. That's it. No advertising targeting, no profile building, no creepy tracking.
privacy.sharing_content: No. Never. Not now, not ever. Here's what we DON'T do: We don't sell your data to advertisers. We don't share your data with third parties. We don't use data brokers. We don't track you across other websites. The only exception is legal: If required by law, we may comply with valid legal requests. But let's be honest - you're opening digital card packs, not plotting world domination.
privacy.rights_content: Since your data lives on your device, you have complete control over it:
privacy.access_content: Your collection and settings are stored in your browser's LocalStorage. You can view them anytime by opening your browser's developer tools (F12) and navigating to the Application tab â†’ Local Storage.
privacy.deletion_content: Want to start fresh? Clear your browser's LocalStorage for this site, and your data will be completely deleted. Just like that time your dad "organized" the garage by throwing everything away. In most browsers: Right-click â†’ Inspect â†’ Application â†’ Local Storage â†’ Right-click â†’ Clear.
privacy.optout_content: Don't want to be counted in our analytics? No problem! Use your browser's privacy settings, install a privacy extension (like uBlock Origin or Privacy Badger), or disable JavaScript (though the game won't work without it). We respect your choice completely.
privacy.security_content: Since all data lives on your device, security is largely in your hands. Here's what we do on our end: (1) Use HTTPS encryption for all data transmission. (2) Follow security best practices in our code. (3) Regularly update dependencies to patch vulnerabilities. What you should do: (1) Keep your browser updated. (2) Use a secure device (not a public computer). (3) Clear your data if you use a shared device.
privacy.children_content: DadDeckâ„¢ is family-friendly and suitable for all ages. Since we don't collect personal information, we don't need parental consent. But if you're a parent concerned about your child's online privacy: (1) All data is stored on your child's device, not our servers. (2) We don't track or profile users. (3) You can clear the data anytime by clearing browser LocalStorage. (4) Teach your child about online privacy - it's never too early to learn!
privacy.changes_content: We may update this privacy policy from time to time to reflect changes in our practices or for legal reasons. When we make significant changes, we'll update the 'Last Updated' date at the top of this page. Continued use of DadDeckâ„¢ after changes means you accept the new policy. (But let's be honest - since we don't collect much data, changes will be rare and minor.)
privacy.contact_content: Have questions about this privacy policy or how we handle data? Want to report a privacy concern? You can reach us at: DadDeckâ„¢ Privacy Team - privacy@daddeck.tcg (Note: This is a hypothetical contact email for the privacy policy. In production, replace with actual contact method.) We'll respond to legitimate privacy inquiries within a reasonable time. Though, like a dad returning emails, it might take us a few days.
privacy.dad_joke: Why did the dad read the entire privacy policy? Because he didn't want any surprises, just like when he checks the restaurant menu before ordering!
